contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox University President | name =John Thornton Kirkland | image =JohnThorntonKikland.jpg | caption = | order = | university =15th President of [[Harvard University]] | term_start =1810 | term_end =1828 | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | order2 = | university2 = | birth_date ={{birth date|1770|8|17}} | birth_place =[[Herkimer County, New York]] | death_date ={{death date and age|1840|4|26|1770|8|17}} | death_place =[[Boston, Massachusetts]] | predecessor =[[Samuel Webber]] | successor =[[Josiah Quincy III]] | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | alumnus = | residence = | profession = | religion = | spouse = | children = | website = | footnotes = |}} '''John Thornton Kirkland''' (August 17, 1770 – April 26, 1840) served as [[President of Harvard University]] from 1810 to 1828. A religious minister like many of his predecessors, he is remembered chiefly for his lenient treatment of students. [[Kirkland House]], one of Harvard's undergraduate "houses," or residence halls, was named in his honor and in recognition of his term at the school's helm. [[Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.|Oliver Wendell Holmes]] describes him thus, in his study of [[Ralph Waldo Emerson]]: "His 'shining morning face' was round as a baby's, and talked as pleasantly as his voice did, with smiles for accents and dimples for punctuation.... It was of him that the story was always told,--it may be as old as the invention of printing,--that he threw his sermons into a barrel, where they went to pieces and got mixed up, and that when he was going to preach he fished out what he thought would be about enough for a sermon, and patched the leaves together as he best might." His contemporary [[George Ticknor]] described Kirkland's sermons as "full of intellectual wealth and practical wisdom, with sometimes a quaintness that bordered on humor." Kirkland served as pastor of the [[New South Church (Boston, Massachusetts)|New South Church]] in Boston, 1794–1810. ==External links== * [http://www.harvardsquarelibrary.org/HVDpresidents/kirkland.php Biography and summary of presidency, part of a series of Harvard's Unitarian Presidents] {{s-start}} {{s-aca}} {{succession box | before=[[Samuel Webber]]| title=[[President of Harvard University]]| years=1810–1828| after=[[Josiah Quincy III]] }} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of Harvard University}} {{Authority control|VIAF=3215311}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kirkland, John Thornton | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = August 17, 1770 | PLACE OF BIRTH = ''unknown'' | DATE OF DEATH = April 26, 1840 | PLACE OF DEATH = ''unknown'' }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kirkland, John Thornton}} [[Category:1770 births]] [[Category:1840 deaths]] [[Category:Presidents of Harvard University]] {{US-academic-administrator-stub}}
